availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Felix G. Matheny (Mercer County, Ky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Elvina MacCoun Matheny in Mercer County, Kentucky, in January 1829. Father of Samuel Matheny, James H. Matheny, William Matheny. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Employed F. Grundy as a farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 259A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 835.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 782.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 58B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 581A.
Find A Grave, "F. G. Matheny (1807-1879)," Memorial #131383961, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/131383961/f.g.-matheny (accessed July 9, 2021).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191851.
